Episodes.description: A Hollywood studio makes a movie based on Comic Book Guy's comic book character "Everyman," and Homer is cast in the lead. However, Homer's weight fluctuations cause problems for the production.
Episodes.title: Homer the Whopper

Episodes.description: When Bart's prank gets Ms. Krabappel fired from Springfield Elementary School, he tries to make it up to her without letting her know that he was responsible.
Episodes.title: Bart Gets a "Z"

Episodes.description: Marge takes on the owner of an ultimate fighting league in the ring in order to get the sport banned in Springfield.
Episodes.title: The Great Wife Hope

Episodes.description: Lisa becomes livid with Miss Hoover, and in a series of homages to classic Hitchcock sets out for deadly revenge. Next, Krusty's latest fast-food sandwich transforms news anchor Kent Brockman into an enraged zombie and twenty-eight days later, cannibal zombies have overrun Springfield. In the final frightening fable, Homer accidentally falls through a trapdoor in Moe's tavern and impales himself on the pipes of Moe's microbrewery. Moe serves the barflies a glass of delicious beer flavored with Homer's blood and Homer, now half-man, half-brewing apparatus, returns for ...
Episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XX

Episodes.description: Marge rediscovers her sexuality after appearing in a racy calendar, but Homer is too tired to respond to her advances because he is being worked to death by his new boss, Carl.
Episodes.title: The Devil Wears Nada

Episodes.description: Bart meets the boy responsible for the greatest prank in Springfield Elementary School history, and discovers that he's now a 19-year-old loser. Meanwhile, Marge is scolded for providing unhealthy snacks for Maggie's play group.
Episodes.title: Pranks and Greens

Episodes.description: Homer becomes an expert on moonshine when he starts hanging out with Cletus after he saves the Simpsons' lives, while Lisa becomes friends with three teenage Wiccans.
Episodes.title: Rednecks and Broomsticks

Episodes.description: Bart becomes jealous of Maggie and Lisa's special bond as sisters, so he goes to an orphanage and "adopts" a little brother.
Episodes.title: O Brother, Where Bart Thou?

Episodes.description: Homer becomes jealous when a syndicated newspaper columnist begins publishing Grandpa's stories, while Bart is assigned to take care of the class's stuffed sheep for the weekend.
Episodes.title: Thursdays with Abie

Episodes.description: The antagonism between Krusty and the new female co-star forced upon him soon turns to romance, while a headhunter encourages Homer, Lenny and Carl to take a job at another nuclear power plant.
Episodes.title: Once Upon a Time in Springfield

Episodes.description: Homer can't tell Marge he won the lottery because he was supposed to be giving a wedding toast when he bought the ticket. But Bart soon finds out where he's hiding the money and begins to blackmail him.
Episodes.title: Million Dollar Maybe

Episodes.description: Homer and Marge become members of the U.S. Olympic curling team. At the games, Lisa becomes addicted to collecting pins, and Bart tries to save her.
Episodes.title: Boy Meets Curl

Episodes.description: While searching for an admirable ancestor for a class project, Lisa discovers the story of a relative named Eliza Simpson, who may or may not have helped a slave escape to freedom.
Episodes.title: The Color Yellow

Episodes.description: When Bart unsuccessfully tries to play Homer and Marge against each other, he comes up with a dangerous prank that is sure to get their attention.
Episodes.title: Postcards From the Wedge

Episodes.description: Bart gets Springfield Elementary School in legal trouble when he kisses the enigmatic daughter of two lawyers, while Lisa is depressed about being ostracized because she is smart.
Episodes.title: Stealing First Base

Episodes.description: Ned takes the Simpsons on a pilgrimage to Israel in order to try and save Homer, but soon discovers that he may not be worth saving.
Episodes.title: The Greatest Story Ever D'ohed

Episodes.description: Mr Burns is sent to prison for art theft, where a scary inmate introduces him to religion. Meanwhile Smithers becomes the boss at the plant, and Bart and Lisa try to share an ant farm.
Episodes.title: American History X-cellent

Episodes.description: Homer and Chief Wiggum's new friendship is put to the test when the chief becomes needy after being shot, while Marge suspects that Bart may be dealing drugs.
Episodes.title: Chief of Hearts

Episodes.description: After a violent storm, Lisa tries to rally the townspeople and come to the rescue of a beached whale.
Episodes.title: The Squirt and the Whale

Episodes.description: ringfield covers the town with surveillance cameras after Homer creates a bomb scare at the train station. Meanwhile, Lisa considers becoming a brunette so that people will take her more seriously.
Episodes.title: To Surveil With Love

Episodes.description: Homer, Apu and Reverend Lovejoy all suspect that Moe may have left with one of their wives after receiving a mysterious letter, but which one is it?
Episodes.title: Moe Letter Blues

Episodes.description: Bart is convinced that the Simpsons' new friendly, unassuming neighbor is actually Sideshow Bob in disguise, but will anyone believe him before it's too late?
Episodes.title: The Bob Next Door

Episodes.description: Moe's gruff and abrasive personality makes him the perfect hyper-critical judge, and lands him a spot on American Idol. Meanwhile, Homer makes Marge uncomfortable when he starts spending more time at home with Moe's now closed.
Episodes.title: Judge Me Tender
